Description: Textile; embroidery (garment?); small fragment of undyed linen, embroidered in red, dark blue, green and yellow wool; small scale geometric design based on lozenges and zigzags. A fragment of plain undyed linen, finally woven (b), backing to embroidery (a). (a) base textile; embroidery; wool and linen simple tabby, darning stitches and cross stitch Warp: S-spun linen, ca 20 ends/cm Weft: S-spun linen, ca 16 ends/cm Edges: two turned under, others fragmentary Sewing: (a) joined to (b) with fine S-spun Z-ply linen thread; wool yarns weak Z-spun S-ply. (b) backing; linen simple tabby, mixed spinning. Warp: 4 threads S-spun, 4 threads Z-spun, ca 23 ends/cm Weft: mixed spinning, irregular arrangement, ca 26 picks/cm Edges: fragmentary Sewing: (a) joined to (b) with fine S-spun Z-ply linen thread; wool yarns weak Z-spun S-ply.
Curator's comments: History of use:use uncertain. Note cross-stitches in yellow wool, confirming embroidery, not brocading. Late dating depends partly on Z-twisted yarns of wool, and linen of (b). H. Granger-Taylor, 7/9/1989
Condition: (a) poor - very fragile (b) fair - fragmentary conservation: date unknown, stuck down to a sticky net
